title: Permanent ban
body:
Seriously? 

I've put a lot of time, money and effort into this game. I have said stupid stuff and raged. But getting a permanent bane because of this? What in the hell is going on? This does nothing to people who are trolling and who don't care. I've invested a lot of money into this and when i get put on a Ranked team that feeds and i rage, the justice is ban the guy who cares. Fuck the trolls and smurfs and people elo boosting. They can keep on doing that. 
Instead, We Here at Riot want to encourage trolls and people who create new accounts to continue not getting punished while people like me who are frustrated and clearly tilted get fucked. And you don't even include all the shit talking everyone else did to me, just what i said. Another thing is the fact my ability to play this game is solely left in the hands of the Trolls that caused me to rage in the first place is unacceptable. I was off having an off game, that coupled with the other players who didn't get punished and after two games I'm permanently banned from League of Legends? 

If the crime im guilty of to get permanently banned is a feature the dev team cant figure out that i have to mute people every single game and there is no universal mute button i can press, then what the hell? It should be made to where im permanently chat restricted. Not permanently banned from the game. Seriously.

This is unfair.

replies.body:
>  I was off having an off game, that coupled with the other players who didn't get punished and after two games I'm permanently banned from League of Legends?

You have been given 2x 10-game chat restrictions, 2x 25-game chat restrictions, and a 14-day ban (which warned you the next would be a perma) before this. Not to mention the numerous penalties prior to the implementation of the escalation system.

> This is unfair.

If the above points were not enough, your chat log from game 1 contains hate speech. We have stated many times that we have a zero tolerance policy for hate speech.

Behavior like this is not tolerated in the League of Legends community.

And you say behavior like this isnt tolerated yet i experience it in every single game. Literally every single game i have played i have experienced language abuse. If this is something you guys dont tolerate, why dont you eliminate it. Stop banning peoples ability to play, and ban their ability to talk. makes so much more sense.
It is "tolerated" by the League of Legends community, its not tolerated by Riot or the boards community tho
Then explain why the "tolerators" (usually those who speak said terrible language) are the ones getting permanently banned?
Its not "tolerated", its just not really seen as homophobic by most people.

I think you're crazy if you think most people don't recognize that word as a homophobic slur. Don't pretend that it isn't an offensive word, that's a non-starter. It is obviously a hurtful word to a lot of people and Riot and the community at large agree that it has no place in League of Legends.

Yea... That's why during anti-gay protests they used the exact phrase "God hates (That word)".
That's also why most people use it to describe something in place of the word "gay" which is sometimes used to describe something stupid when it shouldn't be.

You were verbally abusing, harassing and using hate speech towards players in your game because they were doing well. Doing well in a game is not trolling, cheating or against the rules. If you feel that someone may be breaking the rules you have the option to submit a report, attacking them only risks your account receiving a punishment. Looking into your account you have previously received multiple chat restrictions and a two week suspension for your continued negative behavior in games.

I understand that. But the simple word %%%got is not hate speech. It is an English word. I used the word in a way to express anger, hot hatred. The only infractions i have ever had on this account are all related to me being angry.  I did report that guy. But nothing will happen. The tribunal only attack those who are viewed as being hateful, which i was not being. I was being stupid and stubborn, but not hateful. In fact the only thing people say about that entire game long conversation is the only hateful speech i used was one word. I do not agree that i should be permanently banned. I would happily take a permanent chat restriction. Or have it to where other people cannot see what i type? That would also help on the toxicity that i was facing in those two games.

Even using the word in anger, you were using it to verbally attack another player in your game. I wasn't only focusing on just the use of one word, what was more concerning to me was the way you were going after players because they were doing well. You harassed them, insinuated they were cheating because of how well they were playing and even threatened them with reports. Given the whole of the behavior in your game justifies the punishment on your account. 

Now in regards to nothing happening to the player you reported, you do not know that. If they were doing nothing wrong, then of course nothing will happen to them. But if they were breaking the rules in one way or another, they will see their own sort of punishment issued to their account.

So what happens when I was right and he was cheating? Then me saying that guys is cheating and calling him out is still a bad thing? Why cant i just be permanently banned from speaking to other people or having them speak to me, why can this not be a thing? I think everyone would be happier here if it was. I could no longer call cheaters cheaters and say hateful things to people, but i could still enjoy the account i put hundreds of dollars into.

> [{quoted}](name=th3sidekick,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=EafH9Ipx,comment-id=0004000100020000,timestamp=2016-03-29T00:11:56.685+0000)
>
> So what happens when I was right and he was cheating? Then me saying that guys is cheating and calling him out is still a bad thing? Why cant i just be permanently banned from speaking to other people or having them speak to me, why can this not be a thing? I think everyone would be happier here if it was. I could no longer call cheaters cheaters and say hateful things to people, but i could still enjoy the account i put hundreds of dollars into.

First of all, you're still assuming they're cheating. You can't prove it at all. Don't state it like it's a fact.

Second, that was a small reason for why you got banned. Even **if** you were right and they were cheating, you would still be deserving of this ban.

Last, you don't get to decide what your punishment is. Riot tried the whole perm-chat ban thing. It didn't work as they hoped. And if you wanted to enjoy your account that you spent so much on...Well, probably should've thought about that after your 2-weeks. You're the one that robbed you of your account for the way you acted. Riot does not owe you anything, even with the amount you've spent.
Again, his behavior does not excuse your behavior.

Just as an analysis and not meant to be defending this guy, think of this as a** devil's advocate response.** I wish that you'd sincerely take the time to fully read this over. Even if you don't feel like responding, that's fine. Just let it sit in your head and remember it when a pivotal point in time comes around.

---

Ironically the word bigot means "a person who is intolerant toward those holding different opinions".

---

The community has been told many times that cuss words don't influence your ban as long as they're not being used in a negative connotation, so using it as an adjective is okay.

So if we replace the word "fucking" because it's used as an adjective to express anger and not being used in a negative connotation

Lines in bold are unjustifiable comments.
**
th3sidekick: jesus you two are useless**
th3sidekick: [gosh darn] smurfs man
th3sidekick: you [intolerant person]
th3sidekick: if he isnt [really a] smuf then he is scripting
**th3sidekick: oriu shut the [heck] up;**

Calling people useless, okay. Probably. That's one strike. In one game.

Telling someone to shut up isn't really.. Worth throwing them in jail for. I mean come on, there's nicer ways to say it but it wouldn't make someone hate their life if you told them to shut up for being a jerk.
**
th3sidekick: ali STOP GOING IN ON 2V1 you shit fuck**

Okay. Another single strike in a game.

---

That all said I have no doubt that he's probably shown some phases where he goes overboard consistently. However, don't you think reform cards should show those instead of minor offenses? No one is going to kill themselves for being told to shut up. No one is going to get depressed over an obviously angry guy calling them a shitfuck. We **know **it's written out of anger.

---

Why do we have to act like No Child Left Behind took control of the community? A majority of the people can agree that, yes, it's a good idea because it serves to better the community, but the people being punished are identifying the problems that the system has when they're experiencing it.

People are thrown in jail for "substance abuse". Almost all the people who have done so cried out, "Hey this isn't fair!" but until very very very very very, recently, no one listened to them. They said, "You're a criminal, why should I listen to you." Then all the sudden, someone who **skirted the system** in a high place of power, said something and now everyone thinks it's a good idea.

The people who are getting punished are obviously disgruntled because of something. In this case, he's disgruntled because he feels unjustified that he has to play with people who have no business being there. If you're playing Little Leagues and an obviously older person who's on a High School team subs in for a person on either team, hey I'd say something. Wouldn't you?

But instead of looking at the issue,** you're looking at the effect of the issue, and if the effect of this issue isn't in agreement with your terms you punish them**. You're conveniently eliminating them from the community for any reason to save face.

---

Do you really want to punish these people? Do you really want to jail people because they're already in distress? Sports serve as an outlet for frustration, as well as many other things. Letting someone get something out of their system isn't a bad thing. It helps people let go. Studies have shown that parents that have told their children to "Suck it up" and "You'll get over it" end up being more prone to depression or low self esteem in life. Do you really want these people to bottle up their emotions? To "suck it up"? I'd hope your answer would be no.

---

Okay so we've got all the problems down. Now what about solutions?

The silliest one I can think of is **mandatory enforcement of the chat filter.** Okay okay, I know, unpopular opinion. Hear me out. Is someone really going to type something in chat when they know it's going to get filtered? "____bag of ____." I'm already laughing my butt off. It turned something that sensitive individuals would take offense to, and lets their mind wander. If they're not already thinking about negative things, "____ bag of ____" could turn into something rather hilarious; "Dirty bag of Doritos" for instance.

The people who are looking for a fight, or already in a bad mood have a chance to be like, hey you know what, I'm not going to get mad at this. Obviously this won't catch all cases, but it'll serve as an inconvenience to say bad things. 

But if people feel inconvenienced about talking, how is this any different than bottling up? It shifts their anger. Instead of being angry at their teammate, they're now directed at "the ____ chat filter". Redirection is a very good method for relieving stress.

---

The game itself has evolved into a very competitive environment. Now we have numbers labeling everything we do. We've got borders and divisions, and all this stuff that we compete over. Don't let these be tools to be used against us. Take away the weapons. Provide barriers. Eventually they'll just decide, you know what, it's not worth it.

Well I've lost track of what I've been writing. Got distracted by something and I'm immediately no longer interested in what many people would call this to be a "toxic, negative" behavior because of the things I have written. The method is already working for me. I'll call it a day for now. Good night.

Because what's important isn't whether he was offending you or not, nor whether you were offended or not. What's important is whether general public find it offending or not, since that's what the authority - Riot - is based off with usually. If you're offended you deal with it however you deem fit, and reporting it is certainly one way to do it but nothing says authorities would agree with or approve your report.

You walk on a street, see an asian and you report to the police that his/her skin color has offended you. I don't think I need to tell you who they'll end up arresting.

they wouldn't arrest a person for that...they would be issued a warning.  If the person issued hate speech against that skin color, then it could be considered a public disturbance or verbal assault

if you want a similar bad analogy, a kid gets punched by another kid...the kid punched hits back because the other kid thought they could walk off.  Both kids issued one punch to another, but one walks away without a bruise and receives detention, the other, the next day, is reported to have gone to the hospital.   The actions are inappropriate, but inaction is just as inappropriate
